docs.abstract: Westchester County Board of Legislators, responding to report by US Public Interest Research Group and ranking by Environmental Protection Agency as one of 474 counties nationwide with unhealthful air quality for particulate matter and ground-level ozone, commissions task force made up of environmental groups to produce report pinpointing local sources and recommending changes; task force will explore ways to introduce cleaner diesel fuel before new EPA regulations take effect in 2006 and 2007; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: THERE'S something in the air besides fall leaves and a cool breeze: high levels of particulate matter and ground-level ozone. So high, in fact, that Westchester County, along with the rest of the metropolitan region, ranks the fourth worst in the nation for dangerous levels of particle pollution and seventh worst for ozone, according to a report released in September by the United States Public Interest Research Group.
